title: Identify slope
description: Recognize and define slope as rate of change in linear functions.
example_easy_question: What is the slope in y = 3x + 1?
example_medium_question: Find the slope from the table of values.
example_hard_question: Explain how slope represents a constant rate of change in a real-world scenario.

title: Identify intercept
description: Recognize and define the y-intercept in a linear function.
example_easy_question: What is the y-intercept in y = 3x - 2?
example_medium_question: Given a graph, identify the y-intercept.
example_hard_question: Interpret the meaning of the intercept in a real-world context.

title: Calculate slope from two points
description: Compute the slope using the formula (y2 - y1)/(x2 - x1).
example_medium_question: Calculate the slope of a line from two given points with fractional coordinates.
example_hard_question: Explain why slope is undefined for vertical lines using two-point reasoning.

title: Write equation from slope and intercept
description: Form the linear equation y = mx + b using known slope and intercept.
example_easy_question: Write the equation of a line with slope 2 and intercept -1.
example_medium_question: Given a graph showing slope and intercept, write its equation.
example_hard_question: Given a real context, determine m and b and write the equation describing the situation.

title: Write equation from two points
description: Determine the equation of a line when two points are provided.
example_easy_question: Find the equation of the line through (0,3) and (2,7).
example_medium_question: Find the linear equation through two non-integer points.
example_hard_question: Use two data points from a real situation to construct the equation and interpret parameters.

title: Graph linear functions
description: Plot the graph of a linear function using slope and intercept or points.
example_medium_question: Graph a line using two given points.
example_hard_question: Graph a linear model derived from real data.
